Wildlife Tracker API

Wildlife Tracker API documentation

Welcome to the Wildlife Tracker API documentation.

models.py

SQLAlchemy ORM models for the Wildlife Tracker backend.

Defines database tables for herds, families, events, and observations, including relationships and geospatial fields.

class models.Event(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy model for an event related to a family.

Parameters:

  • id -- Primary key.

  • family_id -- Foreign key to the family.

  • description -- Description of the event.

  • latitude -- Latitude of the event.

  • longitude -- Longitude of the event.

  • location -- Geospatial point (PostGIS).

  • ts -- Timestamp of the event.

  • event_metadata -- Optional metadata (JSON string).

  • family -- Relationship to Family object.

event_metadata
family

id

location

ts
class models.Family(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy model for a wildlife family.

Parameters:

  • id -- Primary key.

  • herd_id -- Foreign key to the herd.

  • friendly_name -- Human-friendly name for the family.

  • created_at -- Timestamp when the family was created.

  • updated_at -- Timestamp when the family was last updated.

  • herd -- Relationship to Herd object.

class models.Herd(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy model for a wildlife herd.

Parameters:

  • id -- Primary key.

  • species_name -- Name of the species.

  • description -- Optional description.

  • created_at -- Timestamp when the herd was created.

  • updated_at -- Timestamp when the herd was last updated.

  • families -- Relationship to Family objects.

class models.Observation(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy model for an observation of a family.

Parameters:

  • id -- Primary key.

  • family_id -- Foreign key to the family.

  • ts -- Timestamp of the observation.

  • latitude -- Latitude of the observation.

  • longitude -- Longitude of the observation.

  • location -- Geospatial point (PostGIS).

  • size -- Size of the family observed.

  • health_rating -- Health rating (1-10 scale).

  • observation_metadata -- Optional metadata.

  • family -- Relationship to Family object.

Herds API endpoints.

This module provides endpoints for managing wildlife herds and their observations.

Endpoints:

  • POST /api/herds

  • GET /api/herds/{herd_id}

  • GET /api/herds

  • GET /api/herds/{herd_id}/observations

api.herds.create_herd(herd: HerdCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Create a new herd. If a herd with the same species_name already exists, do not add it.

Parameters:

  • herd -- Herd creation data.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

The created Herd object.

Raises:

HTTPException -- If a herd with the same species_name already exists.

api.herds.get_all_herds(db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Retrieve all herds.

Parameters:

db -- Database session.

Returns:

List of all Herd objects.

api.herds.get_herd_observations(herd_id: int, start: datetime = None, end: datetime = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Retrieve all observations for a herd, optionally filtered by time range.

Parameters:

  • herd_id -- The ID of the herd.

  • start -- (Optional) Start datetime for filtering.

  • end -- (Optional) End datetime for filtering.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

List of Observation objects.

Families API endpoints.

This module provides endpoints for managing wildlife families, their metrics, events, and observations.

Endpoints:

  • GET /api/families/{family_id}/metrics

  • POST /api/families

  • GET /api/families/{family_id}

  • GET /api/families

  • GET /api/families/by-herd/{herd_id}

  • POST /api/families/{family_id}/events

  • POST /api/families/{family_id}/observations

  • GET /api/families/{family_id}/observations

api.families.create_event(family_id: int, event: EventCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Create a new event for a family.

Parameters:

  • family_id -- The ID of the family.

  • event -- Event creation data.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

Success message.

Raises:

HTTPException -- If the family is not found.

api.families.create_family(family: FamilyCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Create a new family. If a family with the same friendly_name already exists, do not add it.

Parameters:

  • family -- Family creation data.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

The created Family object.

Raises:

HTTPException -- If herd_id is missing, herd does not exist, or family name already exists.

api.families.create_observation(family_id: int, observation: ObservationCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Create a new observation for a family.

Parameters:

  • family_id -- The ID of the family.

  • observation -- Observation creation data.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

Success message.

Raises:

HTTPException -- If the family is not found.

api.families.get_all_families(db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Retrieve all families.

Parameters:

db -- Database session.

Returns:

List of all Family objects.

api.families.get_families_by_herd(herd_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Retrieve all families belonging to a specific herd.

Parameters:

  • herd_id -- The ID of the herd.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

List of Family objects in the herd.

Raises:

HTTPException -- If the herd is not found.

api.families.get_family(family_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Retrieve a family by its ID.

Parameters:

  • family_id -- The ID of the family to retrieve.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

The Family object if found.

Raises:

HTTPException -- If the family is not found.

api.families.get_family_metrics(family_id: int, start: datetime = None, end: datetime = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Get time-series metrics (size, health) for a family.

Parameters:

  • family_id -- ID of the family.

  • start -- (Optional) Start datetime for filtering.

  • end -- (Optional) End datetime for filtering.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

List of (timestamp, size, health_rating) tuples.

api.families.get_family_observations(family_id: int, start: datetime = None, end: datetime = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Retrieve all observations for a family, optionally filtered by time range.

Parameters:

  • family_id -- The ID of the family.

  • start -- (Optional) Start datetime for filtering.

  • end -- (Optional) End datetime for filtering.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

List of Observation objects.

Observations API endpoints.

This module provides endpoints for querying wildlife observations, including spatial queries.

Endpoints:

  • GET /api/observations/nearby

api.observations.get_nearby_observations(lat: float, lng: float, radius_km: float = 5, start: datetime = None, end: datetime = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Get observations near a geographic point.

Parameters:

  • lat -- Latitude of the center point.

  • lng -- Longitude of the center point.

  • radius_km -- Search radius in kilometers.

  • start -- (Optional) Start timestamp for filtering.

  • end -- (Optional) End timestamp for filtering.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

List of observation records as dicts.

Events API endpoints.

This module provides endpoints for querying wildlife events, including spatial queries.

Endpoints:

  • GET /api/events/nearby

api.events.get_nearby_events(lat: float, lng: float, radius_km: float = 5, start: datetime = None, end: datetime = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Get events near a geographic point.

Parameters:

  • lat -- Latitude of the center point.

  • lng -- Longitude of the center point.

  • radius_km -- Search radius in kilometers.

  • start -- (Optional) Start timestamp for filtering.

  • end -- (Optional) End timestamp for filtering.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

List of event records as dicts.

Overtime API endpoints.

This module provides endpoints for time-bucketed metrics for families and herds.

Endpoints:

  • GET /api/overtime

api.overtime.get_overtime_data(entity_type: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), entity_id: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), metrics: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), start: ~datetime.datetime = Query(None), end: ~datetime.datetime = Query(None), bucket: str = Query(1 day), db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Get time-bucketed metrics for families or herds.

Parameters:

  • entity_type -- "herd" or "family".

  • entity_id -- Comma separated entity IDs.

  • metrics -- Comma separated metrics: location,size,health.

  • start -- (Optional) Start datetime for filtering.

  • end -- (Optional) End datetime for filtering.

  • bucket -- Time bucket size (e.g., "1 day").

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

List of time-bucketed metric records.

Nearby API endpoints.

This module provides endpoints for spatial queries to find families near a location.

Endpoints:

  • GET /api/nearby/families

api.nearby.get_nearby_families(lat: float = Query(PydanticUndefined), lng: float = Query(PydanticUndefined), radius_km: float = Query(5), start: datetime | None = Query(None), end: datetime | None = Query(None), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]

Get families near a geographic point.

Parameters:

  • lat -- Latitude of the center point.

  • lng -- Longitude of the center point.

  • radius_km -- Search radius in kilometers.

  • start -- (Optional) Start timestamp for filtering.

  • end -- (Optional) End timestamp for filtering.

  • db -- Database session.

Returns:

List of Family objects within the specified area and time range.
